    • Constructor Detail

      • LearningTreeNode

        public LearningTreeNode(java.lang.String statement,
                        boolean question)
        Constructor for a Learning Tree Node that will hold a statement which can either be a question or an answer. Statement should not include punctuation so: When the statement is a question let it be in the form: "Is this a question" When the statement is an answer let it be in the form: "answer"
        Parameters:
        statement - string to be kept in node
        question - boolean to determine if statement is a question or an answer
        require
        Make sure statement is formatted as specified above.
        ensure
        Node will be initialized with all params initialize and toString() method will take care of question and answer grammar/punctuation

    • Method Detail

      • getStatement

        public java.lang.String getStatement()
        Return statement without toString() formatting
        Returns:
        string statement
        require
        This node must be initialized and contain a statement.
        ensure
        Statement will be returned without any of the toString() formatting.

      • setStatement

        public void setStatement(java.lang.String statement)
        Replace current statement with a new statement.
        Parameters:
        statement - without formatting or punctuation.
        require
        Statement must follow the formatting restrictions from constructor.
        ensure
        Statement will be reset.

      • isQuestion

        public boolean isQuestion()
        Determine if this node's statement is a question or answer
        Returns:
        boolean True = question, False = answer
        require
        This node must be in initialized and contain a question status.
        ensure
        Question status will be returned.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
